image.altText: vehicles stopped by police on a highway

props.synopsis: A man who covered up an Indigenous woman's hit-and-run death on a Darwin highway has had his sentence reduced on appeal, with the NT Court of Criminal Appeal finding the sentence was manifestly unjust.

title.children: Man who attempted to hide Indigenous woman's body after Darwin hit-and-run released on appeal

image.altText: Unidentified male adult walks hand in hand with child

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has agreed to pay redress to victims of child sexual abuse in sporting institutions, ending a stalemate between states, territories and the federal government.

title.children: Victims of child abuse in sports around the country set to get compensation under new deal

image.altText: The outside of Crocosaurus Cove

props.synopsis: Police say two children under the age of 10 are believed to have broken into the reptile park, killing two turtles and injuring four others.

title.children: Two turtles killed, four others injured after break-in at popular Darwin tourist attraction

image.altText: A man standing outside a building and smiling grimly.

props.synopsis: The homes in Bellamack were found to be riddled with defects such as water leaks and cracked tiles, making them unsafe during severe weather.

title.children: Builder of defective Darwin homes loses appeal, still owes more than $2.7m to homeowners

image.altText: A woman in glasses looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: The financial regulator has taken action against a clothing retailer over concerns the store disputes about exposing vulnerable Aboriginal customers to financial risk.

title.children: ASIC orders NT clothing store to stop letting customers pay through Centrelink deductions

image.altText: A dark-haired woman in a dimly lit room.

props.synopsis: A federal Labor MP has flagged that the Commonwealth could take control of an Aboriginal art gallery project in Alice Springs and described the Northern Territory government's plan to downsize the building "offensive".

title.children: 'Size matters': MP flags possible federal government involvement as Indigenous art gallery saga continues

image.altText: A person holds up twom air conditioner filters. One is clean and the other is covered in dust.

props.synopsis: Cleaning your air conditioner's filters is a simple yet often overlooked task. And it is an important one that can not only improve your general wellbeing, but also save you money on energy costs.

title.children: How — and why — you should clean your air conditioner's filters this summer

image.altText: A view from under a thermometer looking up towards the sun in a blue cloudy sky

props.synopsis: Last year eclipsed predicted temperatures. Now a new study suggests the extra warming occurred when the Earth became less reflective due to a drop in low cloud cover.

title.children: Disappearing clouds could have contributed to hottest year on record

image.altText: Maggie Tabberer smiles at a red carpet event.

props.synopsis: She started her career as a model and later became a household name through her work in publishing and television and was a two-time Gold Logie winner.

title.children: TV and fashion personality Maggie Tabberer dies aged 87

image.altText: A crowd of people carrying umbrellas and shopping bags walk along a street on a rainy day.

props.synopsis: After months of saving, households are starting to feel confident enough to spend. Some economists say it is an early indication the stage 3 tax cuts are finally having an impact.

title.children: Households are starting to spend again after holding back for months

image.altText: A young girl with pigtails plays on the sand at the beach.

props.synopsis: The ACT Coroner hands down his findings following an inquest into the 2022 death of five-year-old Rozalia Spadafora, saying she was failed by staff at the Canberra Hospital.

title.children: 'Rozalia was the sun': Mother of girl who died due to failings at Canberra Hospital slams those responsible

image.altText: A man walking down a street wearing a black t shirt

props.synopsis: George Alex and his four co-offenders faced a marathon six-month trial in the NSW Supreme Court over the scheme.

title.children: 'No remorse': Sydney construction boss jailed for more than 9 years over ATO fraud

image.altText: A large sign and crest on a wall saying, Melbourne Magistrates' Court

props.synopsis: A magistrate says a teenager facing explosives charges should remain in custody, after he allegedly downloaded graphic videos of mass murders while planning his own attacks.

title.children: Melbourne teen held in custody after allegedly downloading terror videos

image.altText: Father of Bianca Mark Jones is among the pallbearers carrying her casket out of her funeral

props.synopsis: Bianca Jones has been farewelled by family and friends at a funeral at her old school, after her death from methanol poisoning during a holiday in Asia.

title.children: Melbourne teen farewelled at funeral after Laos methanol poisoning death

image.altText: Grainy CCTV footage of a man in a hoodie

props.synopsis: Now two days into the manhunt for the suspect behind the shooting of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, questions swirl over how he could disappear in the city of surveillance.

title.children: He killed the CEO of a major US health insurer. A CCTV trail unravels his last steps

image.altText: A man looks at the YouTube website on a computer screen.

props.synopsis: In every terror attack or suspected incident in Australia this year, the alleged perpetrator was a young person, says the nation's intelligence chief in a "sobering" warning issued by the security agencies of the Five Eyes nations.

title.children: Five Eyes spies warn of 'shocking' rise in youth radicalisation

image.altText: Storm clouds over Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Thunderstorms are likely to hit Australia's south-east over the weekend as "very humid" weather normally felt in the Far North takes hold, the Bureau of Meteorology warns.

title.children: Severe thunderstorms forecast for parts of south-eastern Australia amid 'very humid' weather

image.altText: A man standing in front of vine leaves making a gesture with his hands on top of each other

props.synopsis: Two men found guilty of murdering 25-year-old Ngor Bol in the Adelaide CBD in 2022 have been sentenced life in prison.

title.children: Two men jailed for life for 'disturbing' murder of Ngor Bol in Adelaide's CBD

image.altText: a young man with a mullet haircut and black t shirt stands on a pathway, looking with a serious expression at the camera

props.synopsis: Alcohol has been an even harder addiction to break than meth for Alex Milovanov, who is now one year sober.

title.children: Alex felt 'destined to be a drug addict'. Now he's overcome addictions he's had since 12

image.altText: Gout Gout gives the thumbs up after a 100m race at the Australian All School Championships.

props.synopsis: At just 16, Gout Gout underlines his potential with more outstanding performances at the Australian All Schools Championships in Brisbane on Friday.

title.children: Teenage sprint star Gout Gout edges closer to breaking 10-second barrier for 100m

image.altText: Two large gold coins bearing engraved "b"s lie on top of a complex financial line-and-bar graph

props.synopsis: It's a wild ride for crypto prices, with volatility for Bitcoin after it surpassed $US100,000. The local share market slid at the close, while Woolworths attempted to end strike action affecting its supply chain. The day's events and insights as they happened.

title.children: Bitcoin price volatile after hitting record, ASX closes in the red — as it happened

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Jeremiah Manele shake hands in front of a row of Australian and Solomon Islands flags.

props.synopsis: The federal government is preparing to unveil a slew of Pacific initiatives designed to bolster its strategic position in the region.

title.children: Australia ramps up policing and security assistance to Solomon Islands

image.altText: CCTV vision of an old man wearing a face mask and wearing a hat and casual attire.

props.synopsis: Police allege gas cylinders were ignited and caused fires in two legal practices, including a Legal Aid NSW office in Gosford CBD.

title.children: Man, 66, charged after gas cylinders ignited in Gosford legal offices

image.altText: Sydney Mardi Gras

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns has slammed a potential ban on NSW Police marching at the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras despite LGBTQ+ community consultation showing a majority do not want officers to take part.

title.children: NSW Police face fresh calls to be banned from Mardi Gras

image.altText: Two men working on a drill rig in outback.

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating after a 29-year-old man was killed at a mineral exploration site in WA's remote northern Goldfields.

title.children: Drilling contractor dies at remote West Australian exploration site

image.altText: Lori Vallow Daybell wears her hair out with a concerned look on her face.

props.synopsis: Already serving three life sentences, Lori Vallow Daybell will now also face trial for the murders of her estranged husband and another man.

title.children: 'Doomsday mum' Lori Vallow Daybell found competent to stand trial for murders

image.altText: A large rock covered in oyster shells and seaweed under the water

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek made the announcement on Friday as part of $107 million for urban river revitalisation projects around the country.

title.children: Mission to return flat oysters to Sydney gets millions to bring 'nature back into our suburbs'

image.altText: An aerial view of Syrian rebels on motorcycles riding around two destroyed tanks on a dusty road.

props.synopsis: Rebels entered the city of Hama, a key strategic city, dealing a new blow to Syrian President Bassar al-Assad and allies Iran and Russia.

title.children: 'The beginning of the regime's fall': Syrian rebels claim second major city in lightning advance

image.altText: A close up shot of the French President Emmanuel Macron delivering a speech.

props.synopsis: Emmanuel Macron used a televised address to accuse the far right and hard left of sowing chaos, after a no-confidence vote brought down the French prime minister and government.

title.children: Macron defiant after no-confidence vote topples French government

image.altText: A feral pig in an outback waterway

props.synopsis: Feral pigs have been sighted in the Flinders Ranges in South Australia, sparking warnings that urgent controls are needed before they become a persistent population.

title.children: Feral pigs make unwelcome move into drier parts of the country

image.altText: A macaque monkey sits on a wooden bridge in an enclosure.

props.synopsis: Launceston's popular City Park macaque monkeys could be gone in 20 years, as a motion to restrict their breeding goes before the council.

title.children: Launceston's popular CBD monkeys to come to an end if council sterilisation push passes

image.altText: The colour shade demonstrated in a piece of leather

props.synopsis: A team of "global colour experts" have unveiled the colour of the year and no, it's not brat green.

title.children: A 'comforting and warm' brown has been named colour of the year

image.altText: A young woman holding a large stuffed toy looks at the camera with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Vika Zadnipryana and Nastia Shadura became amputees when Putin's Russian military hit their homes with missiles. They struck up a friendship while recovering in a hospital, which was also dealing with the aftermath of a deadly strike.

title.children: Teens who met in Ukrainian hospital after Putin bombed their homes have a message for the world

image.altText: A shot of a blue and white plane in the air taken  from below

props.synopsis: Boeing's guilty plea is blocked under a deferred prosecution agreement in the case which dates back to two fatal crashes in 2018 and 2019 that killed 346 people.

title.children: US judge rejects Boeing's guilty plea deal over fatal 737 Max crashes citing diversity policies

image.altText: quix pic

props.synopsis: Righto then smarty pants, think you've been paying attention to the news this week? Test yourself.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: An ATM fee, a win for the Matildas and Australia's most-streamed artist
